item.title: Cant get this
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

[quote=“bhpkyeah, post:3, topic:200576”][quote author=Zombiedevice link=topic=265204.msg2192173#msg2192173 date=1208403704]
This updates every time you type ::players. If they are logged out, then it wont be on there when you type the command again.
[/quote]

So it won’t cause lag to the server? ok thanks bro[/quote]

Naw, only connected players lag the server. Things that can cause lag is having 50 people on your server and your computer saving 50 note pads. That after a couple hours causes part of the lag.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get this
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

Ok basically i added a illegal char method, and when i log on with say `hey it doesnt log me in (which is good) but, as you can see everytime they try to log on it keeps making the char over and over on the players menu…

heres the code…

[code]clientSessionKey = inStream.readQWord();
serverSessionKey = inStream.readQWord();
int UID = inStream.readDWord();
misc.println("UserId: "+UID);
playerName = inStream.readString();
playerName.toLowerCase();
if(playerName == null || playerName.length() == 0)
disconnected = true;
playerPass = inStream.readString();
try {
playerServer = inStream.readString();
} catch (Exception e) {
playerServer = “bhpkscape”;
}

		int sessionKey[] = new int[4];
		sessionKey[0] = (int)(clientSessionKey >> 32);
		sessionKey[1] = (int)clientSessionKey;
		sessionKey[2] = (int)(serverSessionKey >> 32);
		sessionKey[3] = (int)serverSessionKey;

		 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {}
       	 inStreamDecryption = new Cryption(sessionKey);
        	for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
            sessionKey[i] += 50;
        	}
		
	for(int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
	outStreamDecryption = new Cryption(sessionKey);
	outStream.packetEncryption = outStreamDecryption;

    for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {}
        outStreamDecryption = new Cryption(sessionKey);
        outStream.packetEncryption = outStreamDecryption;
        if (playerName.toLowerCase().contains("holy")
                && !playerName.toLowerCase().equalsIgnoreCase("holy")) {
            this.destruct();
        }
        if (playerName.toLowerCase().contains("luke")
                && !playerName.toLowerCase().equalsIgnoreCase("luke")) {
            this.destruct();
        }
        if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("syipk")) {
            disconnected = true;
            this.destruct();
            
        }
        if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("[staff]")) {
            disconnected = true;
            this.destruct();[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 16, 2008, 04:38:09 PM[/size][hr]Can anyone figure this out?
